note.p: Career: Entered the Royal Navy (1844); on the Pacific Station (for 4 years); involved in a Franklin search mission (1850-1851); visited Peru (1852-1853); joined the Civil Service (1853); transferred to the Board of Control of the HEIC; Assistant Secretary to the Revenue Department, Indian Office; employed to collect cinchona trees from the Andes and to grow them in India (1860); Geographer to Napier's Abyssinian expedition (1867); left the India Office (1877); organised antarctic expeditions; died after an accident
References: G E Fogg, 'The Royal Society and the Antarctic' in NR 2000 vol 54 pp 85-98
R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
